description.excerpt: Models detection speech bubble in webtoons or cartoons. I have referenced and implemented pytorch-YOLOv4 to detect speech bubble. The key point for improving performance is data analysis. In the case of speech bubbles, there are various forms. Therefore, I define the form of speech bubbles and present the results of training by considering the distribution of data.

The distribution is a figure collected by speech bubbles based on cuts. 
In fact, there are various colors and various shapes of speech bubbles in webtoons.
In this project, two categories are applied, shape and color, and form and Gradation are classified as ect.
This class is not about detection, but about speech bubble data distribution.

faq.excerpt:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61634628/105812024-d0837d00-5ff0-11eb-9977-1ac2805bee71.png) + **Most training data take the shape of ellipses.**

-->

installation.excerpt: + **Pytorch Version** + Pytorch 1.4.0 for TensorRT 7.0 and higher + Pytorch 1.5.0 and 1.6.0 for TensorRT 7.1.2 and higher + **Install Dependencies Code** ~~~ pip install onnxruntime numpy torch tensorboardX scikit_image tqdm easydict Pillow skimage opencv_python pycocotools ~~~ or ~~~ pip install -r requirements.txt ~~~
Note : It's not the final version code. I will the refine and update the code.

invocation.excerpt: python train.py -g gpu_id -classes number of classes  -dir 'data_dir' -pretrained 'pretrained_model.pth'

requirement.excerpt: + **Pytorch Version** + Pytorch 1.4.0 for TensorRT 7.0 and higher + Pytorch 1.5.0 and 1.6.0 for TensorRT 7.1.2 and higher + **Install Dependencies Code** ~~~ pip install onnxruntime numpy torch tensorboardX scikit_image tqdm easydict Pillow skimage opencv_python pycocotools ~~~ or ~~~ pip install -r requirements.txt ~~~

usage.excerpt: + **1. Download weight** + **2. Demo** ~~~ python demp.py -cfgfile cfgfile -weightfile pretrained_model.pth -imgfile image_dir ~~~ + defualt cfgfile is `./cfg/yolov4.cfg`
